Business Development Manager Job at Team Bonding Nigeria




        
    

        
        Team Bonding Nigeria is a corporate team-building company based in Lagos, offering fun, engaging, and results-driven experiences designed to improve communication, collaboration, and productivity within organizations. As a subsidiary of Inshape Fitness Solutions, the company specializes in outdoor adventures, indoor games, wellness programs, and customized bonding events tailored to each client’s goals. With a strong track record serving top brands like Dangote, DHL, and CFAO, Team Bonding Nigeria delivers memorable events that foster unity and boost team performance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager
     

            
    



Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Source and secure new business opportunities
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients and partners
	Develop and present tailored proposals to corporate clients
	Collaborate with internal teams to deliver customized service offerings
	Analyze market trends and competitor activities
	Track performance metrics and provide regular reports
	Represent the company at networking events, exhibitions, and conferences.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in sales, marketing, or business development (preferably in events, training, or corporate services)
	Strong communication, negotiation, and presentation skills
	Self-motivated, target-oriented, and able to work independently
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and CRM tools
	Experience in B2B environments is a strong advantage.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary package
	Opportunity to work in a dynamic and impactful industry
	Growth and career advancement prospects
	Collaborative and creative work culture.


Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Cybersecurity Specialist Job at Cavista




        
    

        
        Cavista is a global technology company creating cloud-based software solutions for clients. With operations around the world, we globalize, standardize and localize our processes, while at the same time remaining sensitive to specific needs in different regions. Our mission is to empower organizations with the world’s best technology solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cybersecurity Specialist

Job Location: Remote
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
We are looking for:
     

            
    




	We are seeking a Cybersecurity Specialist to lead and execute strategic and hands-on security initiatives.
	This role blends high-level architecture design with operational responsibilities such as threat monitoring, incident response, and compliance.
	The ideal candidate will be proactive, technically skilled, and capable of communicating complex security concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


Responsibilities
What will you do:


	Design and implement secure architecture and cybersecurity frameworks across systems and applications.
	Monitor systems using SIEM tools to detect, investigate, and respond to threats in real time.
	Conduct vulnerability assessments, penetration testing, and coordinate remediation efforts.
	Ensure compliance with regulatory standards such as GDPR, HIPAA, and ISO 27001.
	Manage identity and access controls, enforcing least privilege and role-based access principles.
	Implement and manage security controls in cloud environments (AWS, Azure, or GCP—experience in any is acceptable).
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate security best practices across the organization.
	Configure and manage security tools including firewalls, antivirus, IDS/IPS, and patch management systems.
	Develop and maintain incident response plans and lead response efforts during security events.
	Perform forensic investigations and analyze logs to identify root causes and prevent recurrence.
	Prepare clear and concise security reports, dashboards, and documentation for leadership and audits.
	Deliver security awareness training and promote a culture of security across teams.


Qualifications
What you bring:


	Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in cybersecurity within tech-driven environments.
	Professional certifications such as CISSP, CISM, CEH, or CISA are preferred.
	Strong knowledge of network protocols, encryption, risk management, and security infrastructures.
	Experience with tools such as Splunk, Nessus, Wireshark, Palo Alto, and cloud security platforms.
	Proficiency in technical writing, documentation, and reporting.
	Ability to explain security concepts clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
	Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and organized with a proactive mindset.


What will you experience?


	A fast-paced, collaborative, and purpose-driven team environment.
	Opportunities to shape the future of a global tech brand.
	Professional development and leadership support to sharpen your expertise.
	Competitive compensation and a full suite of benefits including health and wellness programs.
	Generous paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and birthday leave.
	A culture that values transparency, creativity, and continuous learning.

Administrative Officer Job at Moniepoint




        
    

        
        Moniepoint Incorporated is a global business payments and banking platform and recently became QED Investors’ first investment in Africa. We are the partner of choice for over 600,000 businesses of all sizes, powering the dreams of SMBs and providing them with equal access to the tools they need to grow and scale.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Officer

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers

About The Role
     

            
    




	The Administrator ensures smooth and standardized administrative operations in the assigned state.
	This role is responsible for correspondence handling, facilities maintenance, inventory control, and workspace management, ensuring Moniepoint’s offices operate efficiently and safely.
	The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, proactive, and capable of driving consistent service quality across diverse functions.


Key Responsibilities


	Administrative Coordination Manage administrative processes including correspondence handling, filing systems, office documentation, and internal communications. Ensure timely dissemination and tracking of internal and external correspondence while maintaining compliance with organizational standards.
	Facility Management Oversee upkeep of the office infrastructure, including generators, meters, water dispensers, and cleaning services. Track utility consumption, implement scheduled maintenance, and resolve emerging facility issues while ensuring a safe and hygienic work environment.
	Office Experience & Support Services Maintain a functional and professional workspace by coordinating logistics for meetings, ensuring availability of supplies (e.g., CWAY water, stationery), and supervising daily operations. Collaborate with staff to meet facility-related needs and gather feedback for continuous improvement.
	Inventory Oversight Maintain accurate inventory records, monitor stock levels, and coordinate timely replenishment of consumables and equipment. Implement controls to minimize loss and optimize usage while ensuring effective vendor liaison and documentation.
	Internal Control & Compliance Implement administrative control systems, including checklists, inspection routines, and SOP compliance monitoring. Conduct periodic audits to identify gaps, ensure policy adherence, and support risk mitigation across administrative functions.
	Performance Reporting Generate weekly and monthly reports on correspondence trends, facility conditions, inventory status, and control implementation. Provide actionable insights to improve efficiency, cost management, and service delivery.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Public Administration, or related field.
	Minimum of 4 years’ experience in administrative, office, or facilities management roles.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and documentation systems.
	Strong communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills.
	Familiarity with inventory systems and facilities maintenance planning.
	Ability to multitask and manage operations across diverse functions independently.


What We Can Offer You


	Culture -We put our people first and prioritize the well-being of every team member. We’ve built a company where all opinions carry weight and where all voices are heard. We value and respect each other and always look out for one another. Above all, we are human.
	Learning - We have a learning and development-focused environment with an emphasis on knowledge sharing, training, and regular internal technical talks.
	Compensation - You’ll receive an attractive salary, pension, health insurance, annual bonus, plus other benefits.


What To Expect In The Hiring Process


	A preliminary phone call with the Recruiter
	An interview with the Hiring Manager
	An interview with a member of our Executive team.

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Project Planning and Delivery Lead",
  "description": "Benmaris Limited started as a professional manpower providers, financial consultants and general works contractor in 2007. It is a wholly owned Nigerian Company. Over the years, it has undertaken many challenging projects and accumulated skills, know-how and experiences in Facilities Management, Procurement and Supply Services, Design and Build Solutions, Project Management Services, Building Construction and related engineering works.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Project Planning and Delivery Lead

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type:&nbsp;Contract

About the Role


	Support the implementation of COMPANY&#39;s Sustainability Lever 1, 2, 3 and 4, the United Nation Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) and the affiliate Biodiversity Action Plan projects.
	Supervise a team of project engineers and a planner for the effective execution and delivery of Social Development and sustainability projects of the JV Asset Budget
	Contribute to the Preparation of the annual work plan including the cost estimates for the execution of the identified projects and interface with JV partner NUIMS for the approval of the work plan and budget.
	Develop project concept and contribute to the preparation of the projects&rsquo; Front-End Engineering Design (FEED) and support development studies needed for projects the validation of dossiers. Interface with the sponsors of projects for proper scope description and schedule alignment.
	Monitor projects performance progress vis-&agrave;-vis the schedule, report schedule slip, review modification or deviation proposals, analyse variation requests, provide scope clarification to contractors as necessary.
	Participate in project concept development brainstorming session, prepare and issue report of such sessions for review and validation
	Review the basic engineering designs, identifying and recommending areas that may require further study, improvement, development or fine-tuning to the hierarchy for consideration.
	Review draft project Scope of Work (SOW), Bill of Materials (BOQ) and ensure that proper clauses, specifications, test and other COMPANY&rsquo;S requirements are included in the SOW and BOQ
	Review the work schedule submitted by contractors vis-&agrave;-vis the contract strategy and planning approved for the project by management or CPSC.
	Ensure proper follow up and monitoring of project work plan and schedule to avoid schedule slippages and timely delivery of project.
	In close co-ordination with the CAPD Planner, ensure all activities included in the entity&rsquo;s annual work package are properly captured and updated in Primavera, 5 weeks lookahead and 24 months lookahead are timely issued for internal review prior to the JV Asset planning meeting.
	Review the contractor request for modification or deviation necessitated by constraints encountered on sit during construction work.
	Review any claim of shortfalls in materials listed in BoQ or omitted items in BoQ, investigate the claim in conjunction with the Quantity Surveyor and justify the reason for the shortfalls as well as the actual quantities and recommend verified quantities to the hierarchy for approval.
	Interface with the various HCDT to collate and review the progress of key projects for proper documentary in the entity as well as enhance the reporting of the affiliate implementation of PIA.
	Put system and arrangement in place for inspection of key projects and programs being implemented by the HCDT, reporting good practices and raising red flags where necessary.
	Executes and maintains various UN developmental projects in the JV Asset for the benefits of the state and the communities in which the COMPANY operate.
	Executes various Nigerian Content Development and Monitoring Board (NCDMB) Human Capital Project (HCD) in line with the regulatory requirements in the NCDMB Act.
	Liaison with NUIMS which involves rigorous budget defence to secure funds allocation annual work programme, periodic budget performance defence to secure cash calls for project execution, annual performance defence to avoid expenditures rejection thereby prevent money loss.

Project Planning and Delivery Lead Job at Benmaris Limited




        
    

        
        Benmaris Limited started as a professional manpower providers, financial consultants and general works contractor in 2007. It is a wholly owned Nigerian Company. Over the years, it has undertaken many challenging projects and accumulated skills, know-how and experiences in Facilities Management, Procurement and Supply Services, Design and Build Solutions, Project Management Services, Building Construction and related engineering works.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Planning and Delivery Lead

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Contract

About the Role
     

            
    




	Support the implementation of COMPANY's Sustainability Lever 1, 2, 3 and 4, the United Nation Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) and the affiliate Biodiversity Action Plan projects.
	Supervise a team of project engineers and a planner for the effective execution and delivery of Social Development and sustainability projects of the JV Asset Budget
	Contribute to the Preparation of the annual work plan including the cost estimates for the execution of the identified projects and interface with JV partner NUIMS for the approval of the work plan and budget.
	Develop project concept and contribute to the preparation of the projects’ Front-End Engineering Design (FEED) and support development studies needed for projects the validation of dossiers. Interface with the sponsors of projects for proper scope description and schedule alignment.
	Monitor projects performance progress vis-à-vis the schedule, report schedule slip, review modification or deviation proposals, analyse variation requests, provide scope clarification to contractors as necessary.
	Participate in project concept development brainstorming session, prepare and issue report of such sessions for review and validation
	Review the basic engineering designs, identifying and recommending areas that may require further study, improvement, development or fine-tuning to the hierarchy for consideration.
	Review draft project Scope of Work (SOW), Bill of Materials (BOQ) and ensure that proper clauses, specifications, test and other COMPANY’S requirements are included in the SOW and BOQ
	Review the work schedule submitted by contractors vis-à-vis the contract strategy and planning approved for the project by management or CPSC.
	Ensure proper follow up and monitoring of project work plan and schedule to avoid schedule slippages and timely delivery of project.
	In close co-ordination with the CAPD Planner, ensure all activities included in the entity’s annual work package are properly captured and updated in Primavera, 5 weeks lookahead and 24 months lookahead are timely issued for internal review prior to the JV Asset planning meeting.
	Review the contractor request for modification or deviation necessitated by constraints encountered on sit during construction work.
	Review any claim of shortfalls in materials listed in BoQ or omitted items in BoQ, investigate the claim in conjunction with the Quantity Surveyor and justify the reason for the shortfalls as well as the actual quantities and recommend verified quantities to the hierarchy for approval.
	Interface with the various HCDT to collate and review the progress of key projects for proper documentary in the entity as well as enhance the reporting of the affiliate implementation of PIA.
	Put system and arrangement in place for inspection of key projects and programs being implemented by the HCDT, reporting good practices and raising red flags where necessary.
	Executes and maintains various UN developmental projects in the JV Asset for the benefits of the state and the communities in which the COMPANY operate.
	Executes various Nigerian Content Development and Monitoring Board (NCDMB) Human Capital Project (HCD) in line with the regulatory requirements in the NCDMB Act.
	Liaison with NUIMS which involves rigorous budget defence to secure funds allocation annual work programme, periodic budget performance defence to secure cash calls for project execution, annual performance defence to avoid expenditures rejection thereby prevent money loss.
	Liaises with the HCDT/community representatives, government representatives, NGOs etc and other related stake holders to define projects/activities for implementation.
	Principally to actualize COMPANY's group policy on Community Affairs.
	Planning, developing, evaluating, executing and delivering/maintaining projects to host communities/operational areas within approved budget and specified time frame to the satisfaction of all stake holders.
	Documentation on Community projects and Reporting.
	Familiarize self with COMPANY's emergency procedures, carry out assigned responsibilities safely and report any incident, unsafe act or operation.
	Ensure all personnel under his/her supervision are well trained and aware of their HSE responsibilities with continuous monitoring.


Requirements


	B.Eng / B.Sc – Civil / Structural Engineering or any other engineering fields.
	Minimum of 15 years of experience of which 10 years must be in an Oil and Gas industry performing a similar job function
	Affiliation with the Nigeria Society of Engineers (NSE) and Council for the Regulation of Engineering in Nigeria (COREN) is an added advantage.
	Good analytical skills
	Good computer skills particularly in the use of Microsoft Office Suits
	Good interpersonal relationship.
